intro: Galvezia grandiflora, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its showy blue or purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Galvezia grandiflora is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
